thread.title: Valley View Stakes | Tiger Ride outlasts Grade I winner Include Betty at Keeneland
thread.title_full: Valley View Stakes | Tiger Ride outlasts Grade I winner Include Betty at Keeneland

author: courier-journal.com
title: Valley View Stakes | Tiger Ride outlasts Grade I winner Include Betty at Keeneland
text:
Tiger Ride's victory Saturday in Keeneland's $150,000 Pin Oak Valley View brought a smile to trainer Graham Motion's face for a reason other than the 3-year-old filly's upset of a Grade I winner.
"How about winning three stakes with Edgar Prado?" Motion said. "It's like the old days. We go back a long way. We've had weeks like this before, but it's been a while."
As Keeneland's Fall Meet came to a close -- races run Breeders' Cup week in Lexington don't count toward the totals -- Motion and the veteran jockey Prado teamed for their third major victory in October.
Tiger Ride came from off the pace to challenge Include Betty, a winner of Belmont Park's Mother Goose earlier this summer, and move away for a length win on the dirt -- not the turf as originally carded after rains fell at Keeneland.
"I was right behind the speed, and when I swung her outside, she had a nice kick," said Prado, who guided the daughter of Candy Ride to 1 1/16 miles in 1:43.88.
Tiger Ride returned $15.80 to win.
Mrs McDougal ran third despite a rough trip up the back stretch and Prado's Sweet Ride fourth in the field of 10 3-year-old fillies, scratched down from the full 14 when Keeneland decided to switch surfaces Saturday afternoon. The race's Grade III status will be reviewed and potentially downgraded because it didn't run on grass.
Tiger Ride improved her career record to 5-0-1 in 9 starts. Her previous best finish in a graded stakes race was fourth.
Motion called his horse, owned by Dixiana Farms, "pretty unique," saying that while she has strong dirt form, he expects her to develop into a better runner on grass.
He and Prado also took Keeneland's Oct. 15 Grade Sycamore and Oct. 18 Rood & Riddle Dowager, both of those races also Grade III tests.
"We've known each other a long, long time," Prado said. "We're lucky together."
